Title: Human Navigation: Occipital Place Area Detects Potential Paths in a Scene
Abstract: © 2017 Elsevier LtdNavigation — determining how to get from where you are to somewhere else — has obvious importance for the survival of motile animals. A new neuroimaging study has revealed that, in the human brain, the occipital place area detects the number of possible paths in a vista.
